official_title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for the conduct of certain projects of research regarding the reproductive health of women.
short_title: Women's Reproductive Health and Medicine Act of 1991

summary.text: Women's Reproductive Health and Medicine Act of 1991 - Authorizes appropriations, in addition to other authorizations, for research: (1) through the National Cancer Institute (NCI), on early detection and treatment of ovarian cancer; (2) through the National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHHD), on the relationship between breast cancer and hormonal forms of birth control; (3) through NICHHD, on the diagnosis and treatment of fibroid tumors in women; (4) through NICHHD, on the diagnosis and treatment of infertility and other disorders associated with endometriosis; (5) through NICHHD, on the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of pelvic inflammatory disease; and (6) through the NCI, on the relationship between the human papilloma virus and cervical cancer.

titles.title: Women's Reproductive Health and Medicine Act of 1991
To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide for the conduct of certain projects of research regarding the reproductive health of women.
